positive.review: I replay the game when I get a hankering to do a lot of organization and automation stuff, it's really chill and easy to play.

This is the type of game where people will play hundreds of hours but not recommend it. Why? Occasional but frustrating bugs, unstable multiplayer (as we are currently experiencing after an update), and limited creative capacity. For some, it feels like a stink on a game that is just -this- close to being a favorite. 

But, what keeps people coming back is the laid back, at-your-own pace adventuring with satisfying moments and a sense of progression that never feels unbearably slow. It's a lovely palette cleanser as compared to the complex and intensive games that seem to have become the norm. It scratches an itch few games can reach, and I'd recommend it as a relaxed multiplayer that can result in some funny but unexpected moments.

This game has an amazing crafting system and exploration. The quests are just enough to push you along and the want for more is plenty to keep you going. I played this game first on my Xbox and 100%'d it, and now I've bought it again on steam following my xbox breaking to do the same. It is a game well worth everyone's time. The automation and base building are simple for necessity, but allow also for players who wish to create elaborate designs and structures to fit their needs and play to their strengths and whims.

Extremely relaxing survival/exploration game, with an interesting approach to automation.
With the latest DLC massive automated production finally gains usefulness.
If you didn't get the game until now, now is the perfect time to jump in!
Great build it game, but check out tutorials by Vainglorious Gaming. I wasted a lot of time in the beginning, not sure how to get things done. After watching his tutorials, I am doing great
Very fun game chill at most times game with amazing exploration, automation and neat hidden story. I love that there is no rush and enjoy finding the space pets.

Astroneer is one of the most relaxing and satisfying exploration games I’ve played. The terrain tool is super fun, the planets look amazing, and building your base feels rewarding without being stressful. Co-op is chaotic in a good way. A few small bugs here and there, but nothing that ruins the experience. Great game to play after a long day.
I havent played this game to much yet only 3h but it has been so much fun with my friend. Very good game

What to say.. This game is just very chill, cozy and nostalgic at this point for me. I am really happy to see that the developers still do add new things to the game so as I revisited the game recently, there was a ton of new things :).

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here is a short summary for those who don't wanna read whole review:

Astroneer is a cozy, chill sandbox game with intuitive mechanics, beautiful visuals, and a relaxing soundtrack. Great solo, even better with friends. Gameplay is easy and satisfying, though it can get a bit grindy later on. Runs well on decent hardware. Story is minimal, but not really the focus. Worth buying on sale. Solid 9/10 for me.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here is what I would say about different aspects of the game:

♦ Gameplay ♦
I enjoy most of the game mechanics, they are mostly intuitive and easy to learn. Game is very chill, I play solo, but I feel like it may be a lot more fun to play with friends, you just need good friend or two, who are willing to work on your basement and automation system. Travel on the planets and digging into the cores of the planets should be easier and more fun with some friends as well, but overall, you are good to go at solo as well. Teraforming in this game is really satisfying.

♦ Graphics ♦
Visuals are simple, but very beautiful. Art style is original and memorable. I just love how materials are represented and how enviroment in this game looks.

♦ Audio ♦
Calm and cozy soundtrack, cute sound effects of your astroneer guy, but also "scared the sh*t out of me" sound of one specific plant which attacks you from far by farting on you. 

♦ PC Requirements ♦
I would say, that you definitely need a decent PC to avoid lagging and low FPS, but you don't need Nasa computer to avoid potato graphic's settings. My old AMD Radeon RX 580 Series runs this game on high settings smoothly.

♦ Difficulty ♦
This is chill game. It's much easier than many other survival/management games. As mentioned before, mechanics are easy to learn and you can progress pretty quickly. It can just become maybe a bit grindy in some stage of the game if you wanna complete the "story" or just hunt achievements.

♦ Story ♦
I said "story", and not story, because there actually is some sort of lore in the game, but this is really not very important part of this game. It's more of a background/context building, than playing a story. You have some missions to fullfill, but aside of that, you explore, harvest resources, make your basement bigger and cooler, 3D print some buggy and ride over the planet. But most of the time, you don't care about the story, I can imagine, that some folks don't worry about it at all.

♦ Price ♦
I would say, that full price is a bit too much for this game. I value the hard work of the developers, but for 30Euros, I can imagine some more complex games, this is just a sandbox where you can 3D print a rocket and visit 7 planets in total. I bought this game on sale, and would definitely recommend to do so to anybody, at least down to 20Euros, but in the end it's up to you and your financial options.

♦ Bugs ♦
In the past, I experienced some crashes because of the big amount of tethers in my game, but when I played recently, I didn't noticed any bugs so kudos for developers :)

If I would have to rate the game on scale 0-10.. 

I would say, for me it's 9/10. 

My only personal issue is that moment when you find yourself doing something repeatidly for too long just to grind some XP or specific resource. But overall, this game just have it's place in my ♥

Astroneer est un jeu relaxant, pensé aussi bien pour le solo que pour la coop, où l’exploration et la créativité priment. Son style visuel se démarque vraiment, et l’équipe de développement suit sa communauté avec des mises à jour régulières. Pas d’ennemis à affronter (appart quelques plantes) : les dangers viennent surtout de tes propres erreurs, ce qui renforce le côté zen mais exigeant.

Le DLC Glitchwalkers apporte de la narration et de nouvelles zones, mais le fait qu’il repose sur une sauvegarde séparée et qu’il soit incompatible avec Megatech le rend dispensable.
À l’inverse, Megatech est quasiment indispensable si tu aimes optimiser, construire des bases massives ou automatiser à grande échelle. Pour son prix, c’est un excellent ajout.

En bref : un très bon jeu, original, solide, et qui mérite clairement son tarif.
I like the graphics and the automation. Theres a lot to do before finishing the game
very fun and cute graphics
this game is a fun sandbox style with sort of clay/cartoon like graphics, one thing i will say you dont always need tethers although they do help
Great game, Perfect amount of grind without becoming unenjoyable. Perfect for casual gaming.

ive played 20 hours without realizing you can quick place tethers.

10/10 game would reccomend
Amazing Game for passing time, 10/10 resource management sim and lite survival game

Some bugs, but looks breathtaking and presents fun challenges to the player, you cant make the same base on every planet or in every place. Events present new content that's both fun to come back to and interesting at it's core.

Some bugs do cause frustrating issues (sometimes vehicles will clip deep into the ground) but overall very fun to play and look at

“Astroneer — игра, где твой главный враг не инопланетяне, а твой собственный интеллект… или его отсутствие.”

Astroneer — это симулятор космического оптимизма: ты каждый раз выходишь из шаттла с мыслью «ну теперь точно не помру как идиот», и каждый раз игра такая: держи моё пиво.

Тут тебя убивает всё, что способно шевелиться, и половина того, что не способно. Растения? Да, эти милые зелёные штуки, которые выглядят как декор из магазина для домохозяек — на самом деле живые мины. Газовые облака? Вполне дружелюбные, если ты любишь умирать как персонаж в дешёвом триллере. Гравитация? Она просто ждёт, когда ты наступишь не туда, чтобы выдать тебе бесплатный урок полётов… с посадкой лицом вниз.

А кислород? Да это вообще лучший друг, который превращается в маньяка-убийцу, стоит тебе отвлечься на секунду. Не следишь — и всё, уже валяешься на поверхности планеты, разлегся как художественный натюрморт «Провал экспедиции №42».

Транспорт в игре — отдельная форма пытки. Каждая машина будто создана инженером, который всю жизнь мечтал только об одном — чтобы ты никогда не вернулся домой. Переворачивается, закапывается, улетает, как будто в ней встроен режим «Хаос».

Но самое страшное в этой игре — это то, что ты продолжаешь играть. Тебя убили? Ладно. Потерял половину ресурсов в дыре размером с твой IQ в момент прыжка? Нормально. Полтора часа строил базу, и её сдуло твоей же кривой логистикой? Бывает.

Итог: 10/10. Прекрасная игра. Ненавижу. Засасывает как чёрная дыра, только чёрная дыра хотя бы не делает вид, что она милая.
me encanto el juego, con amigos es muy divertido y si buscas algo chill para relajarte puedes jugarlo en solitario
Great game! Worth the price. I had so much fun playing it!
Astroneer is a wonderful (yet quite glitchy) game. I've played it since i was ten years old, originally on the switch, and its just gotten better & better.

[h2] My Honest Opinion of Astroneer [/h2]
[h3] It's good. Really good. [/h3]

I got this game quite a long time ago, and played it for a long while. I went into it entirely blind after watching roughly a minute of gameplay on youtube and fell in love with it. Since then, the devs have kept at adding new content, that expands on the game. If you like really sandboxy, cozy games that blend together with exciting adventure/questing than I would definitely recommend this because it just scratches that itch! It's worth the price although obviously you shoul try and pick it up on sale if you can (They might have changed the price since I bought it idk). The visuals and sound design are among one of the reasons I highly recommend it because it sells that space exploration look and calm gameplay (If you aren't on Aatrox). 

Overall, I'd recommend!

It got a lot better of the years. I come back from time to time play a while, get more and more frustrated how clunky it is in a lot of things and stop playing. Still i played over 350 hours so do with that information what you will.

i've fully finished the game on playstation and im currently re-playing it on pc so i can get all the achivements again, this is a good game forsure the automation that you can set up is fun. would reccomand to anyone who wants a space game.
Phenomenal game. Great with others, yourself, and can be a chill time.
I wanted to play this game for a while and when I got a laptop I got this game and it is great [=

I like this game, more than minecraft, maybe. Its kinda like it, just more complicated at the beginning. I think if you watch youtube videos about it and you like it, you can try it. Its just that, its a lot more fun with people. Hopefully they have like a "join random match" thing to play online with randos because thats fun.

Looking for a high quality space game? Look no further! Astroneer is an incredible game about surviving on alien worlds, constructing bases and researching/advancing technology. I would give this game a 9/10 for the sheer longevity of the game's progression (which can be expanded if you want actual decades of fun with the Megatech DLC). I've had this game since the very start, and it's still doing incredibly well. If the length of gameplay doesn't appeal to you, the amazing adventures and interesting features of the game will. Important tip: make sure that you make occasional backups of your main save, on extraordinarily rare occasions (literally only twice in 5 years), a save glitch can show up and wreck your save, which is devastating without backups.

Astroneer is unlike any game I have ever played. Having been around since the Pre-Alpha days and played since then it's been crazy to see all the ways that it has changed since. From the unique visuals to the way that base building works everything about this game has been nothing short of fun. It's awesome to see that the game still receives updates and DLC even now, nearing 10 years next December.

Since the initial alpha release, this game was nice.
Always loved the fact to travel in pace between planets, which is what this game offers, as well as the aspects of a classic survival/crafting game.
Would recommend it for any of my friends.
A fun game to play with friends, but takes a while to get used to the controls
After 300 hours on xbox, being able to play on pc is fantastic. Id recommend this game to everyone.

This game has at least 410 hours of content in the base package, and it's really fun with the whole thing about automation, and each planet being the key to the automation specific resources really encourages you to step outside your comfort planet. Plus, the fact that each planet comes with the resources to escape the planet is really great for people who are prone to misclicking.
Fun alone with friends and creative non the less.

Astroneer is one of those games you launch thinking, “Okay, I’ll just test it,” and then suddenly you’ve played only 5 hours in 2 days, digging like a maniac and collecting compound and resin as if you’re prepping for an interplanetary move.
It’s colorful, relaxing, and it grabs you without even asking for permission. Expanding your little base and exploring new planets is simply amazing.

Sure, sometimes you get lost like a confused chicken because you unplugged your oxygen tether without noticing (yes… it happened more than once), but honestly, that’s part of the charm.
A game that grabs you, chills you out, and makes you feel like a space engineer… even when all you're actually doing is wondering where you left the rover you still haven’t built.
Amazing game there is lots to explore and you will never get bored
i dont have the DLC (which ive heard literally makes the game worse) but at the very least the base game is amazing and even moreso if you can convince a friend to get it and play along with you

This game is a masterpiece. If u wanna chill with friends and have some fun try this. I played for so many hours in like 5 different saves and i finished the game in all of them, its like a 2 week minecraft phase for me. I need 3 more advencements to %100 finish the game and i will do it some day.
this game is very erie while also making you build new structures that are always come in useful

I just started playing this game, but it's genuinly amazing. It's super creative and allows for personal expression and taking it at your own pace. You don't need to sleep or eat or anything like that, just build and make progress on your base. This is a game I can see myself logging a lot of hours on.

What I like primarily is the sandbox, draw/cartoony-ish style, the engineering and the exploring and adventuring. I love space, engineering, base/citybuilding sims and this does well or very well on each of those categories.

What I would like is for a better way to organize / build bases and logistics, like maybe satisfactory for example. The rails and megatech updates do scratch that itch somewhat, but I guess I'm greedy that way.

Overall its an (increasingly) nice and good game in my opinion.
It is probably one of the greatest Open World Survival Craft games I've played in a long while. I've got over 500 hours on this and I'm so addicted.
Very good love the style of the art and gameplay
I love this game, but I wish they would add support for Apple computers.
I adore this little game, played it when it first came out on console and now I own it here too, definitely noticed changes since I last played, nice to see we ain't locked in that tutorial anymore!

I have been playing this game since it released in alpha in my Xbox One, this game is pure peak, and once I start playing it I have it on my mind for a long time, Its fun yet addictive and automating everything is so satisfying. This game just doesnt miss and after all this time they keep updating it, just buy it its peak.

Very addicting once you get into automating each resource collection, etc. Once you start you cant stop untill every planet is industrialised, every resource fully automated, Nanocarbon Alloy, Titanium alloy and many more beautiful resources make everything worth it in the end.
Very good game and highly suggestable if you want to relax, kill time and enjoy some far away lore in the beginning.

This is genuinely one of the greatest games I have ever played. It may not seem like much at first, but the further you get into the game, you begin to realize just how brilliant it is. Yes, it is quite a bit buggy, especially with the recent release of Megatech, but this game has great devs who have already released many patches. This game's simplicity makes it just that much better, it has ups and downs, but that makes it its own game and lets you do whatever you want. And the story, it may not look like it has a storyline, but it does and it is amazing once you understand the lore.
Fantastic game, and definitely better with friends. Bonus points if you decide to communicate only through pointing and dance.
One of my favorite games to play in general! Its such a nice relaxing game!

Cozy and calming. Always looking for friends to play this game.

We all know it, we all love it! You are an Astronaut in a far away galaxy that is briming with potential!! Not only is it a blast to play with friends, Its also the perfect game to pass time with! There are many avenues to make progress which helps prevent things from becoming stale. I can't wait to conquer the entire galaxy and you should too!

This game is so good that I re-purchased this on steam instead of microsoft just for the achievements/dlcs. Sooo addicting man, I am close to 100% the game TWICE, just cause. Great graphics, great story, great features. Also the file size for saves is non-existant, I played on a single world for about 12 hours and its only 1.5 mgb which is insane. 10/10
I love the sandboxyness of this game! It is so much fun to terraform, make different base layouts, and explore the solar system. Also,,, I love the galastropods.

A classic game from my childhood that is still enjoyable to this day, especially with continued support from the developers with new dlcs, even if they don't add much new content the dedication is still admirable.
Muy bueno si te gustan los juegos de gestión, su mecánica de libertad para poner materiales y estructuras es simplemente genial
I have loved with game every since i started playing it. i still play it to this day and can't wait for the new game to come out and i got the new DLC for this game and i have been having fun so far
Astroneer was my introduction to sandbox gaming. I was hooked. Far more players should give it a try.

I enjoy the way it feels like playing skyfactory. You have to do everything at the begining and very little to work with, but then start to automate things and have more tools at your disposole. Thats why I like this game. I would recommend it to anyone who likes to automate things and doesn't care to much about story but still cares about it. Have a great day!
great game im just tired of fighting the camera and leveling the ground
Nice game, not as many bugs anymore from when it launched and has got a complex progression system now

An absolutely beautiful game
with great music and very chill gameplay.
The Devs seem to think so too, because they keep updating and releasing DLCs.
I could only recommend it for a good time, especially with friends

There is definitely a learning curve when starting the game, but once I got used to how the game works the progression and spacing of everything kept me interested, and the storyline of the game is well thought out and properly built in my opinion. There's a bit of automation for those who want it, story for those wanting lore, fun multiplayer experience, and easy replayability. Overall it's a great game in my opinion.

negative.review:
Astroneer, on the surface, can be a good game, the base building is unlike any other ive seen before, and I love the modularity of evreything, and Multiplayer seems fun (never was able to play long with friends due to time zones)

However, the game is filled with issues that have been there since launch (such as items and rovers falling through the ground) and largely, once youve played the game once, you've seen all there is.   

And more recently, the devs have been trying to push players in the community post to play a game, nothing like Astroneer, that theyre not interested in.    Theres a lot more, like ignoring community feedback, pushing out old features and claiming them to be new, and just a general sense that they have no idea anymore how their own game plays. 

Theres more I could say (like the blatant crashgrab dlc-and skins) But dont really wanna get into every little detail.

Game feels like it could do a lot better, if the original team still cared about it.

Game is decent, good fun actually. But the cosmetics and DLC seems to be their primary focus, and in my opinion the prices are far too high. Plus they use an in game shop with premium currency instead of just selling the stuff to us for a cost. The only reason to use premium currency as an intermediary is to attempt to obfuscate the true cost of the items and to make it impossible to actually spend only what is needed to get what you want. The only good reason to have an intermediary currency is if you could earn it in game. And you can't. Its just scummy practices that you hate to see a company take. I also assume they went this road so the DLC list in steam isn't a mile long and who knows how much it'd cost to get everything, but there is a lot to spend money on.
Coop is unstable and causing constant crashes. Hopefully they'll fix this.

Megatech's free update broke the game performance. I am playing this with my daughter, she's on her laptop that used to run this game just fine on medium graphics. After the megatech free update, her fps is in single digits. Unplayable.

I will take this review down if the problem is fixed.

I can not recommend this game in the current state. Multiplayer just doesn't work.
Over a year ago, there were issues with multiplayer crashing. Today, tried to play multiplayer again ,and can't even see friends that are online and in game , let alone join them. Please fix it.
We don't need another DLC. We just need a functioning game.

So, I want to love this game, its so much fun when it works, unfortunatly its a buggy mess. I play on a server and ive lost hours of work due to disconnecting while in a shuttle, loosing those items, items have glitched through the floors (including major ones that you only get one of and need to progress). Overall the game is a buggy mess in all aspects and the Devs dont seem to care. Overall just dont waste your money on this

The game is not worth the current price. I have owned the game since its early days and was looking forward to the exploration and survival aspects of the game. I am not happy with DLCs being introduced now, I think we will only see more and more paywalled content in a game that is not fleshed out yet and has not reached feeling complete.
I spent over an hour on the tutorial and still didn't know what to do. If I needed a tutorial for a tutorial then I don't think I would have enjoyed this game that much.

In a way I enjoy he game a lot, yet at the same time I dislike it.

It's fun yes, that is until the bugs start to appear, and multiplayer is also annoying as you know what.

Vehicles dissapearing through the planet in front of your eyes, things getting thrown into orbit (it's funny the first time but when you see your valuable resources fly into orbit it no longer is funny).

In multiplayer, random disconnects and crashes.

We also found some bugs that may be caused by the  Mega Tech DLC, such as the ability to use shuttles as teleporters to teleport items from 1 planet to another, how? I don't know whenever the game feels like it.

Do I recommend this game? Not in it's current state, no, even though it can be enjoyed from time to time, the mess that it is now just makes me not want to continue playing it.

I really enjoyed this game but with the new DLC that came out: the server kicks you off every 7 minutes, the new DLC structures glitch continuously, the world is just less stable. I really wish the team would have worked out the kinks before releasing the last DLC.
Everyone else might want to wait a bit for the next patch or two. This DLC needed a little more time in the oven. Countless crashes. Makes it really hard to play.

Very amateurish production. Some of the worst user interface i have used. The progression of hopping between planets for seperate resources sounds cool but restarting the entire process of setting up is so tedius and uninviting you never want to leave anywhere. Automation is also limited so did not scratch the satisfactory itch as well. Overall a "mobile" game with a lack of focus and just plain mediocre gameplay(from the jump arcs to individually picking up and putting down things). 
I like the art direction
Tried to play the game with my nephews, when I use the terrain tool, their game crashes and every time they rejoin the game, it crashes again...

Leaving a negative review because of a bug that's been around for 3 years where all the railroads disappear for the multiplayer client and become unusable. 

Astroneer is a really great game otherwise and it pains me to leave this negative review but I will be taking it down once the bug is fixed.

I can imagine this game being fun if you already know everything about it, but when you start it just throws you in with no tutorial or hint and just expects you to know what to do and how to progress. You are left to run around mindlessly while you figure out what you should be doing and yes that might be the point of the game, but I dont feel like wasting 10 hours just trying to figure out where to even start.
For a game thats nearly 10 years old and not in early access i expected to atleast have some kind of guidance.

Despite my over hundred hours in this game something that should be as simple as trying to get a true flat area is impossible unless you always put your base by a Gateway cause the devs deicded to build everything on a Voxel grid. No matter how much time and effort I put into collecting resources its never enough I still need to go back and forth from multiple planets to get simple tasks completed and the automation barely helps in this regard.
If you're even a little bit of a perfectionist like me then I would recommend staying away from this occasional headache of a game.

With the new MEGATECH Update, my FPS is now 4-30fps when doing things. The worst offender is the Buggy. You are driving and the game has to do some physics calculations? 5fps. 
Game ran fine before, and that was when I still had a 2070 Super. Now with my 5070 Ti + 5900X the game should run super smooth, but nope. The game now runs like a PowerPoint Presentation.
Sad new update but the game is completly destroy. crash every 5 min, take 20 min join a friend and the game crash after 5 min. wish they put time in there game now is juste garbage for cash.

No fullscreen option, should have a lock cursor to window or fullscreen option. Not playing it otherwise and not going into folders to change settings that should be accessible to players inside of games for multi monitor players.

After the second disappointing release of a paid DLC with even more paid cosmetics, I am leaving a negative review to show you just how unpleased with your development I am. 

This update was NOT ready for release. This is no longer Early Access. My support for this studio, your game, and any future titles is now gone. I have uninstalled this game for the first time since I bought it in EA. I don't care what promises you make for STARSEEKER, I'm not buying it it. You've lost me as a customer and a supporter.

Your current marketing team needs to go. MEGA-quick.

First I lost hours of progression to a game crash, and then after a very long mining run, my storage glitched through the floor in a cave and I lost everything. The cursor is difficult to see, with no option to resize it or change the small white dot that easily gets lost in all the other stuff on the screen. It is an addicting game for sure, but I just can't stand the instability, and inability to rollback when there is a massive loss of resources due to game bugs.

these "DLC's seem like they should have been included in the base game... just a big bowl of Disappointment. All the planets are identical with different color pallates used. its like the launch of No Mans Sky, just empty space with nothing notable going on. theres no wildlife only plants. no aliens or rivals to fight/ compete for resources. i wouldnt even call this any type of a "Builder" game either lol you just set boxes down and open them and thats it. this game could have been so much more...

pretty cute game and i intend to play this over christmas. but for the love of god you need a better starting tutorial. Currently im using a beginners youtube guide video to help me through it. im googling what buttons to use every 5 minutes because i cant easily navigate the menu. its a cool game. but it is going to take some time for me to learn, and it is causing some fustration.

So I love Astroneer. I've played it a decent amount and recently when I tried to play with friends the terrain was so glitched out we couldn't play and kept dying. Like for us, we spawned IN A MOUNTAIN. Like completely buried. For the host it was an open field. After 2 or 3 attempts we gave up and switched games. I hope this gets fixed. Its best played with friends.

Will be changed to positive as soon as the resolution bugs are fixed. The game always runs at 1080p, if you have multiple monitors, no amount of troubleshooting and trying fixes could change that. Not really acceptable after 9 f-ing years of continuous updates

Really great game, but FIX THE DAMN VEHICLES.
at least add all wheel drive...
The constant need to get out to remove the tiniest obstacles because you are completely stuck ,or to get up a tiny incline is so annoying. Not to mention always flipping over at a mild inconvenience or getting your wheels stuck under a tiny lip is also super bothersome. All of this combined kind of just drags the game down since travel by vehicle seems very encouraged. Would leave a "maybe" review if i could because the rest of the game is quite fun.

I have 6200 hrs in this game. Each time they update, it gets more buggy. They say they playtest, If they do " shame on them".  This was such a GREAT game when it was in Beta, as soon as it released, the first bugs started and continue. 
JOE, you know, it is time for you to go. You are in WAY over your head.  MegaBug Dlc  I would get my money back if I could. The LTE's which take about 20 mins. are all that are worth keeping the game installed.

tons of microtransactions, lack of care for the game, no autosave so if you crash youre fucked and lose possible hours of progress. modern fucking game not having autosave is what gets me. avoid this dogshit game like the fucking plague

ARK style monetization practices. base game is decent but the 100s of dlc and the use of a store in a largely singleplayer game is bizarre. Would recommend other open world survival craft games over this one unless its on sale.

To be clear: I'm not big into exploration games, so this game probably isn't for me.

This game is as wide as an ocean, but as shallow as a puddle.

This game feels like I'm going down a checklist for quests, only to get more quests, only to get even more quests. The progression is poorly paces, and even though you make factories, there isn't a good reason to automate production. Even if there was, there is no way of getting unlimited resources. You have to mine pretty much all of the metals you need for advanced materials.

Exploration is very limited. You need to be connected to an air supply or have oxygen tanks in your inventory, so the exploration feels like short runs where you desperately try to find the resource you are looking for before you have to go back to base to get more tethers or clear up your inventory. This problem still exists even with vehicles because vehicles have a very limited inventory space and you still need tethers to go out to explore.

I can see why people like this game, but the progression is poorly paced and there is no way to build pretty buildings, so not much for me to enjoy.

>open astropedia
>open automation section
>page on logic
>no logic gates

thanks astroneer
still would reccomend the game overall i just don't know where else to complain about this
Played like 2 years ago, was decent. Tried to play Co-OP now and it was terrible. I got dropped on non existent mountain and suffocated
The dedicated server is trash! No console, it just starts as a background process. No admin tools to save/stop the server.

Awesome game in general used to play it a lot on my xbox a couple years back but sadly im going to have to give this game a negative review just because of how they roll out updates as a person who isnt as fortunate as most i find it extremely annoying how the updates are all half free and half DLC instead of just giving us the entire update for free. it makes me very sad that i cant enjoy the entire update just because im too broke to by the DLC to get the rest of the content it makes me think the devs only care about the money which is very disappointing.

ik nothing will change by writing this review but i hope in the future this stops being the case.

I realy like this cozy friends and family game but there are a lot of things that really ruins the mood. First - after so many years all multiplayer issues are still there - items losing interactivity, diappearing in front of joined player (even they are still there) which brings the constant need of re-launching the game and it will not fix it for sure. Joined player's vehicles would suck into the soil and stop moving or even textures won't load all together in time. All player's hoverboards would periodically stuck in place and stop moving. And now we come to the biggest recent disappointment - the Megatech DLC with it's key feature mostly not working and if it is working with additional tweaking it will horribly misbehave. I really like the idea of this DLC and the scale but what I do not like is to pay the cost and get the bunch of irritating bugs instead of fun family gameplay. So this is it - I would not recommend to buy this game until all the bugs in Megatech will get fixed. Because the DLC is pretty much require to be good part into the game and alot of time and effort just to get ruined at the end by things not working.
new update is broken and the game is unplayable

An unfortunate result. The game keeps getting DLCs and updates that just end up either disappointing or broken. Mission objects don't spawn, controls are frustratingly sloppy, hostile flora spawning upside down and hidden, objects falling through the ground. This game could be the most calm game but it just isn't

While I'm sure this game would be pretty fun using a controller, the decisions made for those of us with keyboards, especially in camera movements, are bafflingly bad. If you want to play this game, make 100% sure you have a controller or the patience of a thousand suns.

I used to recommend this game, but the direction it's gone in recent years has taken away from the original mechanics and game design.

They've lost sight of the original purpose of Astroneer since one of the main developers passed away early in development. 

The microtransaction store was added with justification that they 'did not believe in paid DLC'. Few years later, paid DLC is added anyway. Plus microtransaction store gets an irremovable notification icon.

Since release, the majority of updates have only added limited-time 'features' or content that feels anti-astroneer (take away from the atmospher or gameplay) instead of adding genuinely interesting content such as planets or ores.

If you're going to play this game I'd suggest getting the latest pre-microtransaction-shop version, 1.12.95.

I have to say the game itself is fun, and I did enjoy playing it but it just feels too peaceful? I don't mind the mellow aspect but even Minecraft offers some form of combat to keep you engaged. It just feels like I'm playing on creative mode with an oxygen tank.
Super buggy after years. New DLC is unplayable. Do better.

This was a fun tech demo almost ten years ago. Now it just seems like tedium wrapped in a pretty bow. The exploration never gave me anything interesting to tell my friends about, and as a result it never became something worth playing together. Now, there's all this DLC that honestly looks like more trouble than its worth, and a cash shop on top of that! There are far newer games that are far more dedicated to providing a good time, and adding to that they actually make fun for groups of people. Games have evolved, and Astroneer just stays in the past.

Its the classic steam game that releases for 30$ and gives relguar dlc updates for 15$ that should have just been regular updates if the game was being developed.

 pick and choose what you want to give money to. i dont really care for a dlc that gives a planet with all the resources(should have been a normal part of the game) or a dlc that attempts to be factorio/industrial factory lines/assembly lines while making the game tedious due to resource requirements.

Issues with multiplayer makes it not very fun to play. Lost entire ships with gear due to crashing in orbit and apparently it's been a problem for several years. 
Otherwise game is fine in singleplayer but I was looking forward to playing with friends

I cannot recommend this game without a major overhaul to the research and crafting UI. Seven of my fourteen hours has been spent toggling my backpack looking for tethers. Additionally, I've been to three planets, and they're all the same.

The megatech DLC is nearly unplayable. Don't buy it. It's nearly impossible to place these huge, new mega structures neither on flattened nor on rough terrain. I think this needs a rework before I can recommend it.

The rest of the game is great if you can get used to the controls, but don't buy the Glitchwalker or Megatech DLCs.
game lags BIG TIME with the new update, please fix
Astroneer is a fun game when it works. Every 20 mins on average when i try and play with my friends the game crashes.

seems very empty for having so many random things in it - this one must be centered around making a multiplayer community together, very basic base builder and not much else in solo (at least how it feels)
also don't want to buy a bunch of dlc items just to expand basic gameplay .

very stylized walking/building sim, but basic

Yes, this game used to be really good. But a year ago it was "Game - 60%, Bugs - 40%". Now it's "Game - 30%, Bugs - 70%".
Bugs bugs bugs bugs bugs bugs. 
Previously, the game started to break down when there were 4 people in the lobby and all the planets were explored. Now it breaks down when there are 2 people in the lobby and you have visited only one planet.
It's a cringe. They don't give a damn about it every year. Holes in the landscape for your teammates, constant getting stuck in everything. I used to get stuck on a hoverboard very rarely, now any stop on it is getting stuck on a flat surface, it's just terrible!
There were bugs with the backpack and the inability to take out and receive items. Vehicles are constantly overturning. Friezes and horror. This is not a game - it's a bug! The developers don't give a damn and it gets worse and worse with each update. It's a pity, really. They don't care just because there are no games with the same style and gameplay.

My First ever steam review and it has to be about a game I bought to play with my fiance but we are unable to connect via co-op and play together.

I don't know if I'm the only one experiencing this bug, and I don't think it should be necessary to create a dedicated server just to play online co-op.

Watch out before you buy!!!!

Nice game.
For the first 10 hours.
After that it's pain in the asz for crazy camera, horrible vehicle driving, strange car behaviour in planet core.
Fun game until you get to the core and the camera flips in every direction possible, plus you can get softlocked with your rover on pillars.

I really wish the game had better user experience. I spent almost 30 mins trying to figure what I was to do until someone on stream pointed out that I could accept the quest reward. The game makes it incredibly hard (for some reason) to understand what (and how) to do stuff in the game. 

There are other major issues that seriously frustrated my playing experience: 

1. The crafting interface is clunky and not intuitive, and not knowing how to unlock stuff. 

2. There are some random progression quests that show up, with no clear path on how to get there. For example, I had to unlock something for which I needed a smelter. There was no information in the game on how to do that - this was not in any of the printers. I wasn't going to Google this because that is not really how I like to play. 

3. There is no way to traverse the planet other than tethering long distances which I found was really silly in such a massive landscape. I really wanted to enjoy the game, but the devs have made it impossible to like it.

4. What's the point of such a massive compass right in the middle of the screen? This could have easily been a minimap.

5. Most importantly, I didn't find anything in the game sucking me in - there is no sense of curiousness imparted to the player by the game and even exploration is made miserable because of tethering.

Maybe I'm spoilt by No Man's Sky - but it had a way of keeping me hooked in the game unlike Astroneer.

Maybe I'm too dumb for the game, I don't know, but I don't think I've ever been frustrated with a video game as much as I was with Astroneer.

The problem with recommending the game is that you only realize these things after having bought and having started to play. If you can look past all this, and if you don't mind using Google to find how to do stuff, then this game is fine I guess. Otherwise, it is a hard no from me.
not giving updates for free considering the game was garbage when it came out  its disrecpectfull

you'll be fighting the shoddy user interface the whole time while feeling like everything takes too much effort.
and it takes waaaay too long before you get a decent means of getting around without dying of suffocation.
then you get to "the end" and it does a dumb cutscene and dumps you back home...

I loved this game so much when it was in early development. The soundscape and eerie alien environment made for a comfortable yet adventurous experience, and at the time some pretty clever resource mechanics. Now, despite being such an early supporter when the game was being developed, a lot of the new features are locked behind additional DLC that cost together as much as the original game did. I understand studios can't work for free, but maybe it's time to make a new game if you guys can't afford to release content to people who have already purchased the title you are developing. Either that or you should make the updates free like other titles in the same genre have done to great success. For these reasons, I cannot recommend this game at this time.

Good little game, but it has annoying things.

The research layout is terrible. You search for something to research for over 10 minutes. It takes ages to find something. Tutorial is pretty bad too. The planets and resources are pretty much the same.

Glad I got it for $10. Get it on a heavy sale.

The game looks cool but the controls are horrendous! I tried both controller and MnK and still had no clue how to do things. Very limited feedback when you hover over items. I just cannot get enjoyment out of this game if I need to look things up like this especially within the first few minutes of gameplay. There's plenty of games out there that do it way better. These Devs just want to milk horrible a game with DLC. Do not recommend.

You just can't, after more than 5 years, to not support multiple monitors setup and have to rely on external tools to lock the damn cursor in your game and force people to play with a controller like I'm some console peasant.

PC comes with a KEYBOARD and a MOUSE, and most gamers that have the hardware to run this power hungry game will have DUAL or even TRIPLE MONITOR setups.

In 5 years since I've played it, not a single optimization has been done to the engine, not a single fucking thing, maybe you fixed bugs, but optimizations? ZERO! Look into the wrong direction and say goodbye to your FPS, I've played this on a RX5700 XT first time, on whatever 30ish fps it could muster on a 1080p 60Hz 24" screen, I'm currently on a 4070 Ti Super and sure as hell not gonna play on that 30ish fps again on 32" 1440p 165Hz displays.

Get your shit together System Era.

The most atrocious UI and tutorial I've ever seen. Controls are clunky, unintuitive, and frustrating. UI tooltips and descriptions make no sense. Like, if this dev watched a single Game Dev Toolkit video on youtube, this game could be made 1000% more accessible to new players. I was having to play this with a beginner's guide video on my second screen for every single step of the first few missions.

I'm sure there's a good game in here somewhere, but if you demonstrate this level of incompetence within the first 15 minutes, no way am I sinking hours into your game. I value my time more than that. Instant refund.

I'm a bit on the fence with this one.  I think some people will find it fun, but I really didn't enjoy it.

Some reasons why I didn't have fun:

- controls are so counter intuitive.  Not just fixed by re-mapping controls, but the whole way of interacting with things, picking up and placing things, inventory and resource management.  All just felt fiddly, more difficult than it should be, and wrong.

- everything feels clunky and inconsistent.  Eg some stuff is printed from a small printer, some from medium printer.  That's fine.  But then some stuff says 'small printer' but is actually printed from the back pack.  What?

- The mining/digging down mechanic felt haphazard.  Difficult to judge angles and when you are about to drop further than you can jump back up.  Wouldn't matter if you weren't on an oxygen clock.  I get the tethers thing, but it still felt meh.

It's a shame because there are some cool ideas here.  The modular platforms and the way things connect is different and well executed.  If only navigating the world was better.
Megatech is the worst update , I can't open the game and I don't even have the DLC. Hope SystemEra has a great vacation until January , maby after that they will fix the game and I can play it

I really was hoping to like this but I hate it. I love games like this, but the tuning is all wrong. You spend most of the time fussing with pilons to extend your O2 range when all I want to do is explore and have fun. It's like being on a 2 foot leash at all times. Subnautica is one of my fav games of all time so it's not the system concept, this is just tuned terribly and feels awful to play. Also I had to look up guides 3 times in the first hour because it was so unclear what the game wanted me to do to progress. I really tried but at 7 hours I'm giving up this just isn't any fun to play.

game has issues. mainly from limited design and scope. 
Dev are working to add QoL and content. but only as DLC.

Pain in the butt. 3 slides that dont explain anything except basic controls and an ENCYCLOPEDIA to read. Oh and you still won't know what to do at all without looking up guide videos, and thats in the adventure mode that supposedly guides you. Maybe it will get good. But I shouldn't have to do research just for basic stuff. Creators need to stop bringing out DLC and fix their game intro.
i am so confused about what people liked about this game? this game had many many glitches, a poor storyline , a bad crafting system and a bad tutorial.

would be a 10/10 if it had BASE BUILDING, its been years and nothing, i genuinely love the game but im really too slow to do the complex factories people make out here, id rather finish the story and decorate, but theres nothing to decorate with, or walls to decorate, or ceilings , floors, etc etc. please add base building. again, very fun game, but after everything, its doneso, thats why i like satisfactory instead. W game, do not recommend to people with ADHD i think you'll do worse than me
corrupted save file lost hours of progress. Insane this game has no in built backups or even warning regarding the issue had I known I would've backed them up.
Automation tools still break randomly when extracting resources with the auto-extractor.
way to many bad stuf in QOL , automatization is a mess and you need it , and the dam misclicking , its so hard to get a good angle to do stuff ...
THIS FUCKING SUCK WHEN you are trying to driving your trucker not it get stuck on the smallest fucking thing IN THE WORLD FIX YOUR DAM GAME
Played for a few hours, the camera doesnt function easily with Keyboard/Mouse or with Controllers

Decent game, horrendous UX. 

This is an industry problem that is greatly (or horrendously) exemplified here:

Game developers are NOT trained in modern UX/UI, AND they refuse to admit that it is absolutely crucial for a game's success today. If your game has Youtube tutorials that has comments that read "I was about to refund the game until I saw this video", wake the F up. Hire yourself a UX designer, sell 3x the copies of the game.

This game STILL has tons game breaking bugs in it, ship landing and being unable to exit, vehicles falling or phase shifting several miles underground(the vehicle that may be your only source of air) or random things glitching killing you. There are also a lot of bugs that just break the game outright, and corrupt the save file, (these glitches/bugs cause perma-death bugs in hardcore) 

It seems like the company isn't interested in fixing anything (most of these bugs have been here since day one) and just want to crank out new DLC / addons for more money (these also, come with new and old bugs)

Save you're money. Avoid this game. Assuming you don't come across any of the bugs, its still not fun, and VERY, VERY repetitive.

I want to like this game, but the experience is just horrendous. The controls are clunky and the tutorial isn't much of a tutorial so I found myself having to look things up anyway. I wanted to go caving, but whats the point when I can't see anything due to the buggy headlight.

It is very childish, however what ended it for me was the incredible lack of direction in the beginning during the so-called tutorial. There was none. I had tasks to do but no idea how to do them. refunded. 2/10

astroneer has been out for a good long while and over the years I have loved it. After the megatech release tho.... may you be remembered in the stars, instead of a landfill. 

TLDR: Game runs awful now. Do not buy. Do not trust the System!!!
If it had a skill curve for learning how to connect things, instead of wasting my time with how quirks work, I'd appreciate it.  But it's not relaxing.  It's exasperating.

Main Menu UI breaks 50% of the time. 
Dedicated servers are a mess. New DLC equally riddled with bugs. 

I cannot recommend this
too complicated, my brain is not good enough for this game
shit game full of shit bugs crap game, shit dlcs aswell
I just not gonna recommend any game with random 10 years after shitty DLC. It's just meen developers don't wanna develop games, they wanna fuck fans for money.
Coop doesn't work, and none of the dedicated server docker images work either.
tutorial is one of the worst i ever seen. "go print x" or "collect y" with no input what the fuck that means or how to even access one of 800 menus
Every update (DLC) multiplayer breaks more.

played 36 hours landed on the radioactive planet for the first time then my ship got destroyed and a bunch of loot in it got destroyed and getting the ship took me 12 hours so now i have to remake the ship witch will take me another 8 hours so bad design to who ever decided to add the feature to make a PLANT destroy everything you worked hard for i hate them (btw i had 3 infinite generators that you can only get from completing missions got destroyed)

Poor controls, seems like it was designed by someone who has no concept of what fun is.
Even for £7 on sale it was a waste of money and of my time. I will never get that hour back.
Rushed Dlc, Buggy game, was like this before dlc too
fuck me man, my save file keeps corrupting. Maybe its me (its not) I hate this fucking game

my review will be based off jam's review as i had this game since early access - the point in jams (However, the game is filled with issues that have been there since launch (such as items and rovers falling through the ground) and largely, once youve played the game once, you've seen all there is.)

yes - this is a problem still: even out the ground and fill in the missing holes thats how you are suppose to fix this problem. 

now on to my thing the outfits since i have been playing since early access and only had one outfit; the one that seems to not be in the game at this point to me. I really dislike that.... they only gave me like 150 points in the store im not goin to buy outfits even when i see something i like, theres not point to that.
Control scheme is incredibly opaque and tutorial is a joke. If you're going to upend my entire intuition of how a game is supposed to function, at least have the decency to explain yourself.

As a new player I had to pull up and research a guide to get through the beginning missions. Absolutely no tutorial or explanation whatsoever, which can be fine if you've built a game with a strong foundation and clear mechanics. Unfortunately for Astroneer - it did not. I would highly not recommend.

After having taken some time off for a few years, I'd say this game is really incredibly boring compared to other base building and automation games. It's just so much messier and the systems are less engaging than the games of it's same genre. Even worse, after all these years, it's become a buggy mess.
Releasing an unfinished DLC, with known issues and bugs that even breaks the vanilla game, is NOT ok!
After the latest update, the app keeps crashing nonstop. Please fix this, devs.
Kinda boring for the price its just my opinion theres just not much to do
I used to love this when I was 15 but i played it again and I don't think i could've been any more bored

I'd love to say yes but after near 10yrs of development there's still bugs around that should have been sorted long ago. 
Terrain not loading in, causing you to fall indefinitely or just down into the next cave level and lose your stuff.
The vehicles just ragdolling around when you hop on one, happens with the Buggy and the Rovers frequently. 
Again, the vehicles seem to cause severe FPS drops whenever they come off the ground or flip.
Tooltips randomly decide when they want to exist, from not appearing to never vanishing. 
Dropped items/dead body packs will periodically explode when you go near them, try to move them, or open them - in the case of the body pack.

This is a great wee game for exploring, resource harvesting, and base building. I've had this game since Dec 2016 and in many ways it has definitely improved but there is still jarring issues that should've been resolved pre-official release. Instead there's DLC before stable physics, there's MTX before consistent collision detection.

More bugs...Playing on server with friends cannot land on Novus if someone is already on the planet, your game will crash and put you to the main menu. Trying to rejoin the game again just freezes all the buttons in the main menu. 

Two people launching rockets at the same time is enough to crash servers
